verses.verse: And Samson <WH8123> went <WH3212> to Gaza <WH5804>, and saw <WH7200> there a harlot <WH802>, and went in unto her <WH935>.

And it was told the Gazites <WH5841>, saying <WH559>, Samson <WH8123> is come <WH935> hither <WH5437>. And they compassed him in, and laid wait <WH693> for him all night <WH3915> in the gate <WH8179> of the city <WH5892>, and were quiet <WH2790> all the night <WH3915>, saying <WH559>, Let be till morning <WH1242> light <WH216>, then we will kill him <WH2026>.

And Samson <WH8123> lay <WH7901> till midnight <WH2677>, and arose <WH6965> at midnight <WH2677>, and laid hold <WH270> of the doors <WH1817> of the gate <WH8179> of the city <WH5892>, and the two <WH8147> posts <WH4201>, and plucked them up <WH1280>, bar and all <WH7760>, and put them upon his shoulders <WH3802>, and carried <WH5265> them up <WH5927> to the top <WH7218> of the mountain <WH2022> that is before <WH6440> Hebron <WH2275>.
And it came to pass afterward <WH310>, that he loved <WH157> a woman <WH802> in the valley <WH5158> of Sorek <WH7796>, whose name <WH8034> was Delilah <WH1807>.

And the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> came up <WH5927> unto her <WH559>, and said unto her <WH6601>, Entice him <WH7200>, and see wherein his great <WH1419> strength <WH3581> lieth <WH3201>, and by what means we may prevail against him <WH631>, that we may bind him to afflict <WH6031> him <WH5414>: and we will give thee every one <WH376> of us eleven hundred <WH505> pieces of silver <WH3701>.

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> to Samson <WH8123>, Tell <WH5046> me <WH1419>, I pray thee, wherein thy great strength <WH3581> lieth <WH631>, and wherewith thou mightest be bound to afflict thee <WH6031>.

And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> unto her <WH631>, If they bind me with seven <WH7651> green <WH3892> withes <WH3499> that were never dried <WH2717>, then shall I become weak <WH2470>, and be as another <WH259> man <WH120>.
Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> brought up <WH5927> to her seven <WH7651> green <WH3892> withes <WH3499> which had not been dried <WH2717>, and she bound him with them <WH631>.

Now she had liers-in <WH693>-wait abiding <WH3427> in the inner chamber <WH2315>. And she said <WH559> unto him <WH6430>, The Philistines are upon thee <WH8123>, Samson. And he brake <WH5423> the withes <WH3499>, as a string <WH6616> of tow <WH5296> is broken <WH5423> when it toucheth <WH7306> the fire <WH784>. So his strength <WH3581> was not known <WH3045>.

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> unto Samson <WH8123>, Behold <WH2048>, thou hast mocked me <WH1696>, and told me lies <WH3577>: now tell <WH5046> me <WH631>, I pray thee, wherewith thou mightest be bound.

And he said <WH559> unto her <WH631>, If they only bind me <WH631> with new <WH2319> ropes <WH5688> wherewith no work hath been done <WH4399>, then shall I become weak <WH2470>, and be as another <WH259> man <WH120>.

So Delilah <WH1807> took <WH3947> new <WH2319> ropes <WH5688>, and bound <WH631> him therewith <WH559>, and said unto him <WH6430>, The Philistines are upon thee <WH8123>, Samson. And the liers-in <WH693>-wait were abiding <WH3427> in the inner chamber <WH2315>. And he brake <WH5423> them off his arms <WH2220> like a thread <WH2339>.

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> unto Samson <WH8123>, Hitherto <WH2008> thou hast mocked <WH2048> me <WH1696>, and told me lies <WH3577>: tell <WH5046> me wherewith thou mightest be bound <WH631>. And he said <WH559> unto her <WH707>, If thou weavest the seven <WH7651> locks <WH4253> of my head <WH7218> with the web <WH4545>.

And she fastened <WH8628> it with the pin <WH3489>, and said <WH559> unto him <WH6430>, The Philistines are upon thee <WH8123>, Samson. And he awaked <WH3364> out of his sleep <WH8142>, and plucked away <WH5265> the pin <WH3489> of the beam <WH708>, and the web <WH4545>.

And she said <WH559> unto him <WH349>, How canst thou say <WH559>, I love <WH157> thee <WH3820>, when thy heart is not with me <WH2048>? thou hast mocked me these three <WH7969> times <WH6471>, and hast not told <WH5046> me wherein thy great <WH1419> strength lieth <WH3581>.
And it came to pass <WH6693>, when she pressed him daily <WH3117> with her words <WH1697>, and urged <WH509> him <WH5315>, that his soul was vexed <WH7114> unto death <WH4191>.

And he told <WH5046> her all his heart <WH3820>, and said <WH559> unto her <WH5927>, There hath not come a razor <WH4177> upon my head <WH7218>; for I have been a Nazirite <WH5139> unto God <WH430> from my mother <WH517>'s womb <WH990>: if I be shaven <WH1548>, then my strength <WH3581> will go <WH5493> from me <WH2470>, and I shall become weak, and be like any other man <WH120>.

And when Delilah <WH1807> saw <WH7200> that he had told <WH5046> her all his heart <WH3820>, she sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> for the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430>, saying <WH559>, Come up <WH5927> this once <WH6471>, for he hath told <WH5046> me all his heart <WH3820>. Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> came up <WH5927> unto her <WH5927>, and brought the money <WH3701> in their hand <WH3027>.

And she made him sleep <WH3462> upon her knees <WH1290>; and she called <WH7121> for a man <WH376>, and shaved off <WH1548> the seven <WH7651> locks <WH4253> of his head <WH7218>; and she began <WH2490> to afflict <WH6031> him <WH3581>, and his strength went from him <WH5493>.

And she said <WH559>, The Philistines <WH6430> are upon thee <WH8123>, Samson. And he awoke <WH3364> out of his sleep <WH8142>, and said <WH559>, I will go out <WH3318> as at other times <WH6471>, and shake <WH5287> myself free <WH3045>. But he knew not that Jehovah <WH3068> was departed from him <WH5493>.

And the Philistines <WH6430> laid <WH270> hold on him <WH5365>, and put out his eyes <WH5869>; and they brought him down <WH3381> to Gaza <WH5804>, and bound <WH631> him with fetters of brass <WH5178>; and he did grind <WH2912> in the <WH631> prison-house <WH1004>.
Howbeit the hair <WH8181> of his head <WH7218> began <WH2490> to grow again <WH6779> after <WH834> he was shaven <WH1548>.

And the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> gathered them together <WH622> to offer <WH2076> a great <WH1419> sacrifice <WH2076> unto Dagon <WH1712> their god <WH430>, and to rejoice <WH8057>; for they said <WH559>, Our god <WH430> hath delivered <WH5414> Samson <WH8123> our enemy <WH341> into our hand <WH3027>.

And when the people <WH5971> saw <WH7200> him <WH1984>, they praised their god <WH430>; for they said <WH559>, Our god <WH430> hath delivered <WH5414> into our hand <WH3027> our enemy <WH341>, and the destroyer <WH2717> of our country <WH776>, who hath slain <WH2491> many of us <WH7235>.

And it came to pass <WH3820>, when their hearts were merry <WH2896>, that they said <WH559>, Call <WH7121> for Samson <WH8123>, that he may make us sport <WH7832>. And they called <WH7121> for Samson <WH8123> out of the <WH631> prison-house <WH1004>; and he made sport <WH6711> before them <WH6440>. And they set <WH5975> him between the pillars <WH5982>:

and Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> unto the lad <WH5288> that held <WH2388> him by the hand <WH3027>, Suffer <WH3240> me that I may feel <WH4184> the pillars <WH5982> whereupon the house <WH1004> resteth <WH3559>, that I may lean upon them <WH8172>.

Now the house <WH1004> was full <WH4390> of men <WH582> and women <WH802>; and all the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> were there <WH1406>; and there were upon the roof about three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> and women <WH802>, that beheld <WH7200> while Samson <WH8123> made sport <WH7832>.

And Samson <WH8123> called <WH7121> unto Jehovah <WH3068>, and said <WH559>, O Lord <WH3068> Jehovah <WH3068>, remember <WH2142> me <WH2388>, I pray thee, and strengthen me <WH6471>, I pray thee, only this once, O God <WH430>, that I may be at once <WH259> avenged <WH5358> of the Philistines <WH6430> for my two <WH8147> eyes <WH5869>.

And Samson <WH8123> took hold <WH3943> of the two <WH8147> middle <WH8432> pillars <WH5982> upon which the house <WH1004> rested <WH3559>, <WH5564> and leaned upon them <WH259>, the one with his right hand <WH3225>, and the other <WH259> with his left <WH8040>.

And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559>, Let me die <WH4191> with the Philistines <WH6430>. And he bowed <WH5186> himself with all his might <WH3581>; and the house <WH1004> fell <WH5307> upon the lords <WH5633>, and upon all the people <WH5971> that were therein <WH4191>. So the dead that he slew <WH4191> at his death <WH4194> were more <WH7227> than they that he slew <WH4191> in his life <WH2416>.

Then his brethren <WH251> and all the house <WH1004> of his father <WH1> came down <WH3381>, and took <WH5375> him <WH5927>, and brought him up, and buried <WH6912> him between Zorah <WH6881> and Eshtaol <WH847> in the burying-place <WH6913> of Manoah <WH4495> his father <WH1>. And he judged <WH8199> Israel <WH3478> twenty <WH6242> years <WH8141>.
